meanings.definition: A decorative strip of material used to cover transitions between surfaces or to add ornamentation.
meanings.sent1: The white moulding around the door made the room look elegant.
meanings.sent2: She painted the moulding on the ceiling to match the walls.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to play with the dangling moulding, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bright moulding that framed her face beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The intricate moulding on the mirror reflected the sunlight in dazzling patterns.

meanings.definition: The process of shaping a material into a specific form.
meanings.sent1: The artist used clay moulding to create a stunning sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The moulding of the metal was done carefully to avoid any sharp edges.
meanings.sent3: The children had fun moulding playdough into different shapes.
meanings.sent4: His words were like moulding, shaping her thoughts into new perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The moulding of the cake into a castle was a masterpiece of culinary art.

meanings.definition: A soft, furry growth on organic matter caused by fungi.
meanings.sent1: The green moulding on the bread made it inedible.
meanings.sent2: She carefully removed the moulding from the old book to preserve it.
meanings.sent3: The moulding on the cheese looked like a tiny forest to the imaginative child.
meanings.sent4: The moulding on the tree trunk resembled a cozy blanket of nature.
meanings.sent5: The damp basement was filled with the musty smell of moulding wood.
